content: Cultural crisis protocol activated: Jenny spends 3 minutes acknowledging Palestine situation, 'I've been following news... looking at your stories... so much suffering.' Creates safe space for Muslim student during global crisis before gentle transition to work. Demonstrates humanity before productivity.

Game competition cascade strategy: Live research discovers USC Games Expo 2024, Games for Change ($10K scholarship), Swift Student Challenge. Jenny: 'Submit same game to ALL competitions.' USC alignment critical since target school. Timeline: After NCWIT submission.

Medium flexibility doctrine deployed: Folklift video interviews falling through, immediate pivot to written articles. 'Medium doesn't matter, message does.' Draft articles with quote spaces for businesses. Jenny's local journalism experience validates approach. Preserves mission while changing format.

Sensitive topic navigation: Jenny suggests Muslim community profiles during Islamophobia surge but adds 'I don't know if that's too sensitive.' Respects student autonomy on cultural reporting. Balance of opportunity identification with emotional safety demonstrates trust depth.

Live competition discovery process: Real-time searching during session, evaluates if still active (checks 2017 last post), filters for high school eligibility. USC Games Expo discovery creates excitement: 'Especially in USC. That'd be cool.' Adapts search based on enthusiasm.

117 followers lesson framework: Game with tiny following raised $8,000, proving consistency beats virality. Instagram algorithm insight: 'Just need to post consistently.' 120 views on debugging reel validates approach. Demystifies success metrics.

Session achievements: NCWIT essay 2 refined to exactly 250 words, 5+ game competitions identified, USC Games Expo 2024 discovered, Folklift pivoted to articles, Instagram strategy clarified. Writing quality improvement explicitly celebrated: 'Your writing has improved a lot.'

Multi-channel execution: Playing 'Stash the Trash' game together live, screen-sharing essay edits, chat for sentence rewrites, link troubleshooting in real-time. Resource bombardment with competition links, summer programs, Instagram examples. Seamless channel switching maintains engagement.

Local journalism connection: 'I did something similar in high school, neighborhood had own magazine.' Makes path accessible through personal experience. Instagram struggle normalized: '117 followers raised $8K.' Authentic game reactions: 'Wow, that's so cool!' while playing together.

Link annotation formula established: 'URL (description in parentheses)' with technology details. Example: 'Job board I developed for unemployment using React.' Warning: 'No dashes might copy-paste incorrectly.' Creates professional documentation standard for all applications.
